Reviews.Title: “Expensive for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolaM5
Reviews.Content: First trip to Singapore and this hotel was recommended by a friend who lives in Singapore. When we arrived we were able to check in strate away which was lucky as we arrived around 10 am. The room was very small and so was the bathroom but you get used to the bathroom after a while and the shower was actually very powerful. Received free bottled water everyday and toiletries which was nice. There is also complimentary tea and coffee with a kettle but no fridge or milk. That is all the hotel has to offer and there are no other facilities on site. There is free wifi but its not particularly fast.The bed is extremely uncomfortable but again once you slept on it a few days you just get used to it. A lot of reviews have said about the noise and seeing prostitutes in the hotel, we didnt have a problem with either of these. The reception staff are not particularly friendly and luckily we had no problems with anything so only spoken to them on check in and check out. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of a lot of attractions, failing that there is a bus stop only 2 minutes walk and train stations about 5 minutes walk that can take you where ever you want. There are plenty of shopping centres around with plenty of restaurants. Make sure you pick up a map at the airport. Raffles is nearby and try and do a trip to the night safari,china town, marina bay, little india, orchard road and universal studios at sentosa island. Things can be cheap or expensive depending on your budget. There is a free water/light show at the marina bay which is well worth going to of an evening.They dont offer airport transfers but taxis are pretty cheap and when you arrive there is a cheap shuttle bus (just go to the transport desk) There are lots of "Hotel 81" hotels in the area so make sure you say its the one near Shaw tower in Bugis. Location wise this hotel is excellent but it is certainly not worth the price you pay. I think there are probably more value for money hotels than this chain. Having said that, due to the location i would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Bed Sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Geecsy
Reviews.Content: That was my first trip at Singapore so Im observed the city hotel via internet which accorded with my budged, so I prefer to stayed at 81-Bugis Hotel because that hotel located strategic and near from eveywhere. I stayed for 3 night, Its about $138/night (*I thought it was publish rate so I recommend you to book hotels before “H” day via agent) which fasilities LCD TV with bored channels (almost of channels such chineses drama), bed, AC, bath room, water heater and non included breakfast. There’s no window in my room, super duper smallest room & bath room (well.. what I could expect with minimalis budged, right?!) dont expect too much you can enjoy your shower time peoples! The bus station located in front of hotels and you can take taxy easily outside hotels and it take about 10 minutes by foot goes to Bugis MRT Station, you can find many markets around like Bugis Junction, Bugis Streets or Singapore National Library and many more. I aint recommended you to stay at this hotel because the receptionist wasnt helpful so if you wanna ask something they will give their straight face and unhelpful answers. The most selling point from 81-Bugis is this hotel located in Bugis Area. I would prefer to another hotels when I come back to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: fyoj
Reviews.Content: it is a budget hotel so we were not expecting much.. we only need a place to stay at night anyways since we were out for most part of our stay in singapore. it was small but clean. the beds and pillows were ok. the hallways were a bit narrow but was not a problem since there weren't much occupants during our stay. it was hard to understand the staff (language barrier?) but they seemed to be helpful. we were also allowed to leave our things in the lobby after 12noon check out while we continue to roam around the city, since our flight is on midnight. location was great though ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean, very tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Altazon
Reviews.Content: Location: great. Bus and subway nearby, shops, touristic areas. Rooms: very very small, and smell humidity a lot. When you shower, the entire bathroom floods, and despite the use of A/C, the room smells humidity. Conclusion: bad. Service: minimum. No smile, no help to get directions. 2 minutes after check-out, I asked to use the Wifi for 5 minutes... they refused as I had already checked-out... 2 minutes before ! Overall: location is ok, but hotel is definitely old, smells bad, and is not clean. I would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: zimzum42
Reviews.Content: if you're staying here, you should be renting by the hour. Got to be crazy to stay the night... Hotel 81 is for one thing, and one thing only...

Reviews.Title: “Central and clean but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: acjkt
Reviews.Content: My usual Hotel was fully booked so I chose this particular hotel simply for its location. The hotel is five minutes from Bugis MRT and a few minutes from Suntec City. The tiny reception cannot cope at times and I found myself in a queue out to the street when I arrived. The receptionists with the exception of one gentlemen were monosylabic and really didn't want to talk other than amongst themselves. The room was clean, I had a room with a window so that helped. I can imagine the ones without having a tomb effect. There was a large bathroom and everything worked. I'm not sure I would stay here again as the price whilst understandable for the location is simply too high.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable accommodation in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: sprinkled_dreams
Reviews.Content: In a very expensive city, this is one of the cheap hotels - reasonable and comfortable. I stayed here almost a week in June and July with a friend. We were not expecting too much (since it's been said that it is somewhat the cheap motel type) but it's quite reasonable compared to staying in a backpacker's hostel, where you have to share a room and bathroom with the rest of the guests. The room is quite small yet the bed fits just right. The room has a tv, a small closet, a water boiler, some stash of coffee, tea and bottled water. I just don't like the mirrors all over one wall. It might be there to make the space look bigger (but i dare not think of what purpose it serves for others). Same goes for the little toilet and bath, small but decent enough since they have enough soap, towels and toiletries. They have free wi-fi access and complimentary breakfast. The room may not be superb, but the location is EXCELLENT! I love it that everything seems to be just within walking distance - the malls, money changers, convenience stores (7-eleven is just beside it), bugis street and the different museums. There's also a nice coffee shop a few steps away from the hotel which serves really good food for 5 sgd. yum!

Reviews.Title: “A truly horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krillko
Reviews.Content: This sleazy hotel has paper thin door so you really can hear every detail of sex-noises from the other rooms. Trying not to thing about what happened in the bed you're in, but since the mattress is covered in plastic for a reason it's hard not to. The room has no windows. For an extra 10$ you get "internet". Totally unusable, took over 5 minutes to load gmail. After a horrible nights sleep, the paper thin doors allows you to enjoy the cleaning crews radion on full volume.

Reviews.Title: “Hate this awful place”
Reviews.Author: mr_jabberjaw
Reviews.Content: I can't say a single nice thing about this horrible place, except that the location is pretty good. It's not clean--found long black hairs in the shower/toilet. The staff are nasty and they seem to have some of the few in Singapore who are English-challenged. The hotel chain itself is crummy--made a complaint that was never even responded to. Staying in a room without windows is like being in a tomb. If I could give it minus-5 stars I would. This place stinks. And it's far from cheap. The bed is covered in a single sheet sitting on top of a rubber mattress cover that makes the bed intolerable: do they think you are going to wet yourself? I was told by a cab driver this place is used for "quickies." Can't say I saw any evidence of that, but it is a repulsive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel D
Reviews.Content: I paid Expedia £365 for four nights for a standard room at this ghastly hotel. What they don't tell you on the Expedia website is that all their standard rooms have no windows, therefore the light and noisy air conditioning, which you cannot adjust, are on all the time. Only the deluxe rooms have windows! Nor do they make it clear that the bathroom is in fact a wet room with the shower close to the toilet!. At least the sink was big. There was no wardrobe or chest of drawers, just four coat hooks, so it was pointless unpacking. The room accommodated a double bed but otherwise there was not enough room to swing the proverbial cat.The flat screen TV was not aligned with the bed but stuck right in the corner. Their was no table or desk, except for a small bedside table with coffee and tea making facilities. There was not even a chair - a pouffe was the substitute. The saving grace was that the room was clean Grossly overpriced, even for Singapore, If anything, you were paying for location, as it is faily central with Raffles Hotel around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you just need a sleep”
Reviews.Author: bi888
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3days as i have to attend meeting at SUNTEC. I paid SG138 per night. The hotel staffs are not friendly..i guess they dont bother to talk to you also as this hotel is like: "mind your own business" hotels. When i checked in, i saw many girls with old mens at the lobby, when i went out for meeting and when i came back, same sighting. At one point i thought i was at a brothel. However, as i mentioned..this is "mind your own business" hotel. So, i mind my own business...but sometimes i got a funny glance from the old men..this is the part which i dont really like about at this hotel. Room was okay and tv is a flat screen. This is a very small room..toilet and shower are not separated. Food wise, not many choices..but it has a 7th eleven next door which is very near. But this hotel is near to SUNTEC..just a 10minutes walking distance. Will i stay this hotel again? I wont unless i have a business meeting at SUNTEC only! .

Reviews.Title: “Very Small, Noisy and Bad Smell Blanket”
Reviews.Author: PhotoNTravel
Reviews.Content: I'm very unhappy with this hotel. The room too small but price not. My room is no 05 05, blanket smell like cigarette, a towel stuck with somebody hair or ... (I can't imagine). And very bad thing, the room can listen Outside Persons talk Clearly. so I can't sleep allnight.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly receptionist, poor service,dirty bed sheet,noisy”
Reviews.Author: MayOoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights. The hotel is considered cheap for its location. There is convenience shop next door,MRT and food hawker center nearby. Anyway the receptionist we met was very unfriendly and not helpful.The room's toilet is very small, you would hardly to make a move. The most terrible experience was we couldn't get to sleep at night. It was too noisy even at the midnight, you can still heard people walking around, talking,moaning etc.The bed sheet was dirty, we felt very itchy sleeping onto the bed, it was really a nightmare. If you have better budget, please don't choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but too far from MRT!”
Reviews.Author: My_RosyCheeks
Reviews.Content: Our family room was a little small for 3 people but it was well decorated, the bathroom plush and modern and the nights sleep was relaxed and comfortable. The only issue is that its a good 25 mins walk to the closest MRT ( Metro train), so unless you dont mind the walk or are happy to pay for taxis you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean budget hotel but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: peapie0329
Reviews.Content: If you are a book lover you will like this hotel, it is a just a few steps away from the National Library. Also, depending on your pace the hotel is about 2 minute walk to Bugis Junction and Bugis MRT. Beside the hotel is a 7-11 store where you can buy water, snacks etc. A bus stop is right in front of the hotel and you can also hail a cab from there. The checking-in was quick and no fuss, but the lobby was small and it could easily get crowded if there is a group checking in. There were no chairs to sit while you are waiting for your turn at the reception and the hall way leading to the elevator was so narrow and might be a bit of challenge if you have lots of luggage. As expected the room was so small but with large windows, if there’s two of staying in a room I suggest to get the Double bed instead of the twin. That way you get a little bit of leg room when getting out of bed. Taking a shower was a bit of a challenge since there was no bathroom curtains thus everything; the washbasin, the toilet seat were wet. For its good location and its budget price, we’ll stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Small and o.k”
Reviews.Author: baltscottie
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I ever stayed at in Singapore. It was pretty cheap I suppose at around $$120 Singapore per night. The only pros associated with this place is the location and the price. The cons can go on and on. First of all the room is tiny, I mean really really small. In the bathroom you could take a shower while sitting on the toilet. That is how spacious it is. Our room which was on the outside, didn't have 1 window, so it felt like I was in prison. No pool amenities, The TV and channel selection would make you think it was 1985. The breakfast does not impress. Very small restaurant and there is not one thing I could say about the breakfast that would be positive. It absolutely stunk. To sum it up, if you are on a tight budget and have a short stay (2 nights less), consider this place. If not, then bypass this place. For another $40 per night you could stay down at the WWCA off Orchard Road which blows this place away.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small room and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Quinn76
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights this month and hardly recommend this hotel for its room, services and staff. However, the location was great as it located in eating ares and shopping central. From there you can walk to Ochard Road and Marina Bay- 2 of the best places in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better if they simply took care of Air conditioning and Bed”
Reviews.Author: euricia
Reviews.Content: Hotel 81 Singapore hotels are expensive! So we were glad to find this hotel last minute for S$139 a day at the last minute - after checking all the big chain hotels we usually stay at were going for prohibitively high tariffs. $139 is low for Singapore, but is high enough to afford good standards. Unfortunately, some basic standards weren't met by this hotel. We had to change 3 rooms to get a decent room - The 1st room we got smelled of smoke, the 2nd one was too small - with no room to keep 2 bags. After going to bed, we discovered the most uncomfortable bed we'd slept on - with just one white sheet over rexine-covered mattress. The air conditioner didn't cool the room very well. My conclusion is that this hotel can be much better if they simply take care of these to ESSENTIAL issues - which don't cost much. Also, the free internet was painfully slow. In all fairness, the staff at the reception were very courteous and polite.

Reviews.Title: “So far so good”
Reviews.Author: spider999
Reviews.Content: I stay in Superior Room (with large windows) for 3 nights with my wife and I agree most of the people said in this forum. I understand this is a buget hotel and i am happy with my stay. I add some information here. Free of charge storage room Supermarket - fairprice supermarket in rochor center (cheapest) - cold storage in Bugis junction - carrefour in SunTec city Food - hawker center in albert center (next to Bugis street market) - restaurants in purvis street (just one street next to the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “noisy, unhelpful and international phone calls restricted”
Reviews.Author: mere-will
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you actually want: 1) to sleep - too noisy, phones, talking, people moaning next door, people fighting on the street; 2) to use the phone in your room to contact your family back home -there is no international phone access ("sorry ma'am local calls only" - and yet I couldn't get a local phone call to work) and I couldn't use my phone card. The phone handset also kept coming loose from the phone; 3) a bed that isn't covered in vinyl - squeaky and sweaty. The queen bed was firm which was helpful for the bits of sleep I managed. Yes it is conveniently located, but Singapore has many hotels and I'd skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Room was immaculate, rate is reasonable, & location was superb.”
Reviews.Author: eccentric_jan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 days last June 24-27 2010 & the hotel staff delivered what we have expected. The room was good for 2 persons so it was right for us. The room was immaculate & the staff made sure that it was cleaned everyday. Basic neccesities like towels, toothbrushes & etc were also provided daily. The toilet was crammed so it will test your gymnastics skills. But since this is a reasonably priced budget hotel, you should not expect much from it. Also, if you're a claustrophobic, book for a more spacious room & avoid the standard one. Likewise i suggest that you request for a window room. I also noticed that the hotel did'nt have a lounge area so the reception crowded a bit. I have read from the reviews that the hotel is a place for some trysts of lovers, hookers & etc...& the reviews were indeed right! Despite of that, we didnt encounter any inconveniences though. In summary, as long as your a patient traveller, you have to make it work!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Budget hotel - open shower / midnight business”
Reviews.Author: AlienHiker
Reviews.Content: Booked this online for a week. Hotel is new, room was clean and staff was friendly. The location is only couple of blocks from Bugis junction food courts / shopping and also the subway station is there. There were two negatives: a) Though I booked 'luxury' room, the shower bathroom / toilet is very small and there is no shower space / curtail. The end result is that the toilet seat, anything on the washbasin shelf and the whole toilet floor get wet. Initially I thought that it is only a toilet with a washbasin and later I found the shower head in a corner :-) b) In the evening rooms are rented to guys who come with hookers on an hourly basis. This goes on past midnight. Locals told me that it is the practice of this hotel chain and not that the night staff making extra money. What this means is that if you arrive late, you might have to wait. Room cleaning goes all night ... good for guest who are going to check in soon after, but bad for those trying to sleep next door. Also this many not be the best experience if you are with kids. c) though the web site mention "basic business center" there is nothing like that there.

Reviews.Title: “for the practical, no-frills traveller”
Reviews.Author: browneyedgirlManila
Reviews.Content: if you are travelling alone or with a partner, are on a tight budget, will be allocating most of your time and funds to sightseeing/shopping, and just want a clean, comfortable place to stay at night, hotel 81 bugis fits the bill. first thing i noticed about the hotel was its superb location -- just a 5-minute (or even less!) walk to bugis junction, which is just diagonally across the street. the mall has loads of restaurants, shops, a supermarket, and a BHG department store. further down bugis junction is the bugis street market, some hawker stands and temples, an OG department store, sim lim square, etc. so it's a great area for sightseeing. plus, there's an MTR station at the basement of bugis junction, which can take you anywhere in singapore. i found the location very convenient for shopping and also when we suddenly had to buy emergency stuff like water, prepaid cards etc. to my utmost relief, the hotel room was very clean. it's very simple and basic. just a bed, a small side table, flat screen TV with DVD player, a ledge for placing stuff. the room is very small, just enough for 2 adults and maybe 2 big pieces of luggage. as i said, basically just a place to stay at night. but the most important thing to me was that it was clean, and it had no moldy/musty smell like other hotels. and no bedbugs. the bathroom was also very small, and yes, when you shower everything will get wet because there is no divider between the shower, toilet, and sink. but just the same, it was ok with me, since it was clean and had no moldy tiles or icky smell, which i hate, and i'm very particular with clean bathrooms. the water heater and pressure were also fine. the hotel also provides the most basic amenities -- two towels, two toothbrushes, water kettle, one sachet each of coffee and instant cereal, two mugs, one bottle of water, a box of tissues. NO ref, mini-bar, spoons, or closet (just some hooks on the wall). the room does have free wifi, which was super neat. i should also mention the surprisingly good service. for a budget hotel, service was actually efficient and pleasant. the front desk staff and even the housekeeping were quite helpful in answering our questions and smiled a lot. when our first room had leaks coming from the ceiling, they immediately moved us to another room. don't come here if you are travelling with kids or if you are looking for a grand relaxing getaway. but if you're like me who came here for just a super short stay (4 days), was not keen on spending double the price on other hotels, and just wanted a clean and comfy place to rest at night, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap-ish place to sleep near Suntec”
Reviews.Author: colingally
Reviews.Content: Paid 387 Singapore Dollars for 3 nights. Compared to the hotels in the area around Suntec City it was cheap. From looking at previous reviews I knew it would not be The Hilton but I needed a place to sleep and to be able to walk to the conference I was attending in Suntec. Receptionists efficient and friendly enough. You do notice a lot of couples booking in without luggage and you realise what type of establishment it is! My room was the deluxe room on the 4th floor. The corridor was 90% of the time occupied by a cleaning cart and numerous cleaners. The room was quiet small. The bathroom had a dodgy smell all the time I was there and disgustingly there was a sanitary towel on the floor of the bathroom when I arrived. Not a great sign! Free cabled internet was a major plus. TV very small. Sheets/bed o.k. Luckily I sleep o.k. because the banging of the doors, the music played by the cleaners, the sounds of the other "clientele" could have kept me up all night. To be honest if I was paying out of my own pocket again for a conference in Suntec I would probably have to stay here again or try to stay in the relatively reasonably priced and well reviewed Naumi Hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: SCChow
Reviews.Content: as a frequent business traveler to KL & Singapore, Bugis area is the most strategic location to stay when i'm in Singapore. As i have a tight budget, i'm looking for a value for money budget hotel. Hotel 81 in Bugis meets all my basic requirements : Superb Location, Clean, Good Security System, Comfotable Bed, High Pressure Hot &Cold Shower. Good food is available within walking distance, esp the row of shops opposite Bugis Junction Shopping Mall, i enjoy very much the Duck Rice which available at the corner 2 storey old shop.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Stay... Near Suntec”
Reviews.Author: marcgorospe
Reviews.Content: We transferred here after staying 2 nights at Hotel81 Geylang. We had no problem processing the transfer. I recommend staying in a room window (deluxe). It's really a weird feeling not knowing that's it's morning already. We stayed here for one night then went to Malaysia over the weekend for F1 leaving some of our luggage in the hotel because we'll be staying after. pros: > Around 10-15 walk to Suntec City, 15-20 walk to the MRT > Busy street outside > Efficient Staff > Clean room > With Flatscreen TV and DVD cons: > Interesting bathroom. The shower is just beside the toilet. After taking a bath, there's water everywhere. > Watch out the rate as it changes during weekends

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: srajendr
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at Hotel 81 in Bugis for the Singapore F1. Wasn't expecting much from some of the reviews but was quite pleasently surprised. Great location, clean, hot water and close to the action. Booked online from the hotel's website and had no problems with the reservation. Booked a superior room, it had a large window (not a great view but atleast it let in light), an lcd TV, coffee maker, table, stool and queen size bed. This is the Hotel 81 in Bugis, not sure how the other Hotel 81's are, and they are all over Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelley_75
Reviews.Content: Booking a mid-priced hotel during the 1st Singapore GP was impossible just a month prior to the event. This hotel which is normally priced at the lower S$100 per night peaked at over S$250 per night! It's quite expected though with the influx of close to 100,000 tourists for the event. At any rate, we were prepared for the worse after reading all the reviews about the hotel. From horror stories about guests going for hour rates to the much talked about toilet. Our first impression of the hotel was that it's not so bad. The location is wonderful! it's just off Beach Rd and a block away from Bugis Junction. It means shoppping is just around the corner. The hallways are very narrow and you can hear the activity in each room as you pass each one. We got a standard room, which the website described as a room with a queen bed (check!), and an LCD TV (check!). Okay, so there is a side table and a stool. That's it. Bed sheets were clean and that's great. Now for the toilet. In scuba diving live-aboard linggo, we call a toilet like that as an SSS toilet ([--], shave and shower). While it is very clean and has continuous running supply of hot water, it is very small. The shower head can be literally used as a bidet! What the hotel lacks in frills, the location makes up for it. It is within walking distance to 1 MRT stations - Bugis and City Hall. There are small street within the area that offer local food and late night drinks. This is a very very ideal hotel for those planning to watch the Singapore GP next year with a mid-range budget for hotel. It is close enough to the Marina area and takes away the hassle of trying to get in and out of the MRT which was just impossible due to the volume of commuters.

Reviews.Title: “Budget: upgrade for an ex-backpacker”
Reviews.Author: RE-VeeL
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Thursday night and to be honest I wasn't expecting much from previous reviews. I choose it for it's location, which didn't disappoint as it was a stone's throw from all the Bugis shops (5 minutes walk around the block). From the minute I alighted the elevator and walked down the hall to my room to the sounds of "ecstacy" echoing down the hall my main thought was "Good Grief! What have I got myself into?". It was 7pm. The superior room, though very basic, was clean. However it wreaked of cigarette smoke and lacked a remote control to the LCD TV. What the hotel lacks in creature comforts, it definitely made up for in the service department as the housekeeping and reception staff attended to my complaint within 5 minutes of placing the call. That's speedy! The bathroom was small and had the "Singapore special" showerhead over the toilet bowl trick, ("when in Rome" as they say) however it was clean and that's all I really care about. My Superior Room had a: - window - Double bed - LCD TV - Telephone - Complimentary water, instant noodle cup, tea/coffee - Mini Kettle - Hair dyrer - Towels Supplied - complimentary shower cap, toothbrush - Air Conditioning (A/C) Negatives about the Room: - No closet/ wardrobe or clothes hangers - Noisy A/C unit - Noise from the hall echoed into the room so pack you heavy duty ear plugs! As for the "love hotel" factor... well, isn't that what all hotels are about? Hotel 81's patrons are just a little more transparent about it. At least they are in a seperate room to you and not the bunk bed below you. My verdict: If you're looking for five star hotel standards, then don't stop here. If you are an traveller who has graduated from the bunks in a backpacker's hostel want a clean no-frills place to park you stuff and yourself , this might be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....'interesting clientelle'!!”
Reviews.Author: charlie&rich
Reviews.Content: First off, it is worth mentioing that it is in a great location, smack bang in the middle of singapore city so it is very easy to see most of the main sights in the colonial district on foot. However, the hotel is very pokey with six tightly packed floors and with majority of the rooms being very small with no windows, as the hotel is a middle terrace. (I think there are 2 rooms on each floor with windows) The bathrooms are probably the smallest on earth with the shower being situated almost over the toilet! The shower is pretty poor and loses its temperature fairly quickly although it never goes cold. On a positive note the rooms are new with a nice flat screen tv (you couldn't fit a normal one in the room!!), dvd player, and pretty clean so no complaints there, although the bed is not hugely comfortable and the aircon system seems to bring in odours (smoke mainly..) from other rooms. The hotel is also situated right near a karaoke bar 2 doors up, which brings me to the subject of the clientelle! I am not totally saying this maybe the case, but it looked fairly obvious with old gentleman arriving with younger ladies shall we say, and i heard a brief discussion about hourly rates at reception. Naturally this is all asumptive and if this is no big deal to you (as it is behaind closed doors) then there are worse places to stay in Singapore. Besides, hotels are not cheap here! The choice is yours!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81-Bugis
HotelInfo.Address: 31 Middle Road, Singapore, Singapore
